title: powers conferred on me by section 35 of the Prisons Act 2007 (No. 10 of 2007)
heading: 1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Prison (Amendment) Rules 2020.
text_raw:
1. (1) These Rules may be cited as the Prison (Amendment) Rules 2020. 

(2) The Prison Rules 2007 to 2018 and these Rules may be cited together as 

the Prison Rules 2007 to 2020. 

(3) These Rules shall come into operation on 20th July 2020.
text_norm: 1 (1) rule may cited prison (amendment) rule 2020 (2) prison rule 2007 2018 rule may cited together prison rule 2007 2020 (3) rule shall come operation 20th july 2020

title: powers conferred on me by section 35 of the Prisons Act 2007 (No. 10 of 2007)
heading: In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Prison Rules 2007 (S.I. No.
text_raw:
2. 

In these Rules “Principal Rules” means the Prison Rules 2007 (S.I. No. 

252 of 2007).
text_norm: 2 rule principal rule mean prison rule 2007 (s.i no 252 2007)

title: powers conferred on me by section 35 of the Prisons Act 2007 (No. 10 of 2007)
heading: 3. The Principal Rules are amended by the insertion of the following rule
text_raw:
3. The Principal Rules are amended by the insertion of the following rule 

after Rule 32: 

“32A (1) Where the Director General is of the opinion, having 
regard to advice or guidelines issued by the Department of Health or the 
Health Service Executive, or a recommendation by the Director of Prison 
Healthcare Services or a prison doctor, that it is necessary to do so to 
prevent or limit the spread of an infectious disease specified in 
accordance with Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the Infectious 
Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) within a prison, he or 
she may direct the Governor of that prison to – 

(a) 

(b) 

suspend the entitlement to physical recreation, exercise or 
training under Rule 32, or 

restrict or modify the entitlement to physical recreation, 
exercise or training under Rule 32, as regards frequency, 
duration and arrangements, 

for a specified period or periods. 

(2) Where the Governor is of the opinion, having regard to advice or 
guidelines issued by the Department of Health or the Health Service 
Executive, or a recommendation by the Director of Prison Healthcare 
Services or a prison doctor, that it is necessary to do so to prevent or limit 
the spread of an infectious disease specified in accordance with 
Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 
1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) within his or her prison, subject to any 
direction made by the Minister or the Director General, he or she may – 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st July, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [250] 3 

(a) 

(b) 

suspend the entitlement to physical recreation, exercise or 
training under Rule 32, or 

restrict or modify the entitlement to physical recreation, 
exercise or training under Rule 32, as regards frequency, 
duration and arrangements, 

for a specified period or periods.”.

title: powers conferred on me by section 35 of the Prisons Act 2007 (No. 10 of 2007)
heading: 4. The Principal Rules are amended by the insertion of the following rule
text_raw:
4. The Principal Rules are amended by the insertion of the following rule 

after Rule 36: 

“36A (1) Where the Director General is of the opinion, having 
regard to advice or guidelines issued by the Department of Health or the 
Health Service Executive, or a recommendation by the Director of Prison 
Healthcare Services or a prison doctor, that it is necessary to do so to 
prevent or limit the spread of an infectious disease specified in 
accordance with Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the Infectious 
Diseases Regulations 1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) within a prison, he or 
she may direct the Governor of that prison to – 

(a) 

(b) 

suspend the entitlement to visits under Rule 35, or 

regards 

restrict or modify the entitlement to visits under Rule 35, 
as 
frequency, duration and arrangements, 
particularly in relation to the number and age of visitors 
permitted to make visits, 

for a specified period or periods. 

(2) Where the Governor is of the opinion, having regard to advice or 
guidelines issued by the Department of Health or the Health Service 
Executive, or a recommendation by the Director of Prison Healthcare 
Services or a prison doctor, that it is necessary to do so to prevent or limit 
the spread of an infectious disease specified in accordance with 
Regulation 6 of, and the Schedule to, the Infectious Diseases Regulations 
1981 (S.I. No. 390 of 1981) within his or her prison, subject to any 
direction made by the Minister or the Director General, he or she may- 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [250] 

(a) 

(b) 

suspend the entitlement to visits under Rule 35, or 

regards 

restrict or modify the entitlement to visits under Rule 35, 
frequency, duration and arrangements, 
as 
particularly in relation to the number and age of visitors 
permitted to make visits, 

for a specified period or periods.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 July, 2020. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 

Minister for Justice and Equality. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [250] 5
